refnamediv.refpurpose: An implementation of the control interface for GtkWidgets

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Signal Prototypes
Description
refsect1.para: The BonoboControl object implements the CORBA interface for handling remote embeddable components. A Control is a light weight, single view, arbitrarily complex 'widget'. Controls typicaly expose much of their functionality through a property bag.
A BonoboControl provides the server ( or component ) side implementation of a Control. The client that uses this control will probably use a BonoboWidget to use the control in their program.

One final thing worth thinking about is activation. When a control is embedded inside a BonoboControlFrame, it is initialy inactive. In order for the control to recieve interactive input it is neccessary to use bonobo_control_frame_activate. This signals to the control that it is activated, at which point the Control should merge any UI elements it has with the associated BonoboUIComponent. This needs to be done every time the control is activated.

refsect2.title: BonoboControlClass
bonobo_control_new ()
refsect2.para: This function creates a new BonoboControl object for widget.

listitem.simpara: a GTK widget that contains the control and will be passed to the container process.
a BonoboControl object that implements the Bonobo::Control CORBA service that will transfer the widget to the container process.

refsect2.title: bonobo_control_get_widget ()
refsect2.para: Returns the GtkWidget associated with a BonoboControl.

listitem.simpara: a BonoboControl
the BonoboControl's widget

refsect2.title: bonobo_control_set_automerge ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether or not the control handles menu/toolbar merging automatically. If automerge is on, the control will automatically register its BonoboUIComponent with the remote BonoboUIContainer when it is activated.

listitem.simpara: A BonoboControl.
Whether or not menus and toolbars should be automatically merged when the control is activated.
A BonoboControl.
Whether or not the control is set to automerge its menus/toolbars. See bonobo_control_set_automerge().

refsect2.title: bonobo_control_set_property ()
refsect2.para: This method takes a NULL terminated list of name, type, value triplicates, and sets the corresponding values on the control's associated property bag.

listitem.simpara: the control with associated property bag
optional corba exception environment
the first property's name

refsect2.title: bonobo_control_get_property ()
refsect2.para: This method takes a NULL terminated list of name, type, value triplicates, and fetches the corresponding values on the control's associated property bag.

listitem.simpara: the control with associated property bag
optional corba exception environment
the first property's name

refsect2.title: bonobo_control_set_transient_for ()
refsect2.para: Attempts to make the window transient for the toplevel of any associated controlframe the BonoboControl may have.

listitem.simpara: a control with associated control frame
a window upon which to set the transient window.
a control with associated control frame
a window upon which to unset the transient window.
The control
the associated UI component
A BonoboControl object which is associated with a remote ControlFrame.
an optional exception environment
The Bonobo_UIContainer CORBA server for the remote BonoboControlFrame.
A BonoboControl object whose Bonobo_ControlFrame CORBA interface is being retrieved.
an optional exception environment
The Bonobo_ControlFrame CORBA object associated with control, this is a CORBA_Object_duplicated object. You need to CORBA_Object_release it when you are done with it.

refsect2.title: bonobo_control_set_properties ()
refsect2.para: Binds pb to control. When a remote object queries control for its property bag, pb will be used in the responses.

listitem.simpara: A BonoboControl object.
A Bonobo_PropertyBag.
An optional exception environment
A BonoboControl whose PropertyBag has already been set.
The Bonobo_PropertyBag bound to control.
A BonoboControl which is bound to a remote BonoboControlFrame.
an optional exception environment
A Bonobo_PropertyBag bound to the bag of ambient properties associated with this Control's ControlFrame.

refsect2.title: bonobo_control_activate_notify ()
refsect2.para: Notifies the remote ControlFrame which is associated with control that control has been activated/deactivated.

listitem.simpara: A BonoboControl object which is bound to a remote ControlFrame.
Whether or not control has been activated.
An optional exception environment

refsect2.title: bonobo_control_window_id_from_x11 ()
refsect2.para: This mangles the X11 name into the ':' delimited string format "X-id: ..."

listitem.simpara: the x11 window id.
the string; free after use.

refsect2.title: bonobo_control_x11_from_window_id ()
refsect2.para: De-mangle a window id string, fields are separated by ':' character, currently only the first field is used.

listitem.simpara: CORBA_char *
the X11 window id.

refsect2.title: bonobo_control_do_popup ()
bonobo_control_do_popup_full ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean bonobo_control_do_popup_full (BonoboControl *control, GtkWidget *parent_menu_shell, GtkWidget *parent_menu_item, GtkMenuPositionFunc func, gpointer data, guint button, guint32 activate_time);

refsect2.title: bonobo_control_life_set_purge ()
refsect2.para: Set time we're prepared to wait without a ControlFrame before terminating the Control. This can happen if the panel activates us but crashes before the set_frame.

listitem.simpara: method to call at idle when no controls remain

refsect2.title: bonobo_control_life_instrument ()
refsect2.para: Request that control is lifecycle managed by this code; when it (and all other registerees are dead, the all_dead_callback set by bonobo_control_life_set_callback will be called at idle.

listitem.simpara: control to manage.

refsect2.title: bonobo_control_life_get_count ()
refsect2.para: calculates the number of live controls under management.

listitem.simpara: the number of live controls.

refsect2.title: The "activate" signal

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
